column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Social issues
#Text=Let 's get into social issues now .
#Text=You criticized President Obama for his stance that same-sex marriage be left to the states .
#Text=With the Tenth Amendment in mind , why should same-sex marriage be a federal issue and why should the federal government mandate that states allow same sex marriage ?
#Text=Well I think that first and foremost that as president of the United States you take an oath to govern under strict adherence to the U.S. Constitution .
#Text=I would espouse ...
#Text=I would suggest that marriage equality is a constitutionally guaranteed right of Equal Protection Clause that is on par with Civil Rights of the sixties .
#Text=It 's not a states issue , that it 's a federal issue and that the federal government should be involved .
#Text=If you say it 's a state issue where 42 states have said that marriage is between a man and a woman .

#Text=Effectively what you 're saying is that ' I 'm not going to do anything when it comes to marriage equality ' , and I take the position that marriage equality is a constitutionally guaranteed right so goes the federal involvement .
#Text=Libertarian Party and political future
#Text=Okay I 'm getting to my final questions here .
#Text=I want to talk about the Libertarian Party .
#Text=The first nominee of the Party was John Hospers , who died last year , and he was a supporter of Republican President George W. Bush .
#Text=The next nominee Roger MacBride also left the party and went to the Republican Party .

#Text=The 1988 nominee Ron Paul , as we all know , serves in the House of Representatives as a member of the Republican Party , and his son [ Rand Paul ] serves in the Senate as a member of the Republican Party .

#Text=Both the 2008 presidential and vice-presidential nominees of the Libertarian Party : Bob Barr and Wayne Allyn Root have recently rejoined the Republican Party and have both endorsed Mitt Romney for president .
#Text=In fact , until the end of last year , you too were a member of the Republican Party .
#Text=So why does it seem Libertarians flock to the Republican Party ?
#Text=I 'm not so certain ...
#Text=I think that the tie-in is [ libertarian ] Republicans are fiscally conservative and socially accepting .
#Text=That 's the , I think , the heading under which most Americans are .
#Text=I will just tell you that last night , although it did not happen , apparently the Democrats were going to come and protest my speaking at the University of Colorado at Boulder .
#Text=I guess it was all those anti-gay , anti-immigration , pro-Drug War , pro-military interventionists that were going to show up and protest me .
#Text=But you admit that there are some Liberty Republicans and that Republicans make up a large portion of libertarians .
#Text=Is that correct ?
